entry.title: [Epic] Patient Disease Data Structure
entry.content:
### Question
[link](http://www.mitbbs.com/article_t0/JobHunting/32844253.html)
> Suppose N patients and M diseases. N is sufficiently large number and M is relatively small, say 30-ish. Each patient can have possible 0 to M kinds of diseases.
> Given one patientâ€™s name, show me a list of similar patients sharing same deseases within 2-3 seconds.
### Solution
__Use 1 bit to represent a disease__. So every patient's conditin can be put into an integer of 32 bits.
How do we calculate the similarity of 2 patients?
Refer to __[CC150v5] 5.5 Calculate Bits Conversion Required__ for a special bit operation (remove last '1' from bit):
> c = c & (c - l) clears the least significant bit of '1'. > > Keep doing this until all '1's are cleared.
For each patient, we simply calculate the XOR and count '1's.

no code.
